summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors between 1994 and 1997, and with perjury for false statements made in a 2016 deposition. The document details her alleged role in grooming and facilitating the abuse of victims as young as 14.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, and with perjury. Alleged to have played a critical role in grooming and facilitating the abuse of minor victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and co-conspirator with Ghislaine Maxwell. Alleged to have sexually abused minor girls with Maxwell's assistance between 1994 and 1997.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who announced the charges against Ghislaine Maxwell and made a statement about the case.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.context: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the New York Field Office of the FBI who commented on the case, praising the victims' bravery.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.context: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department who made a statement condemning the alleged crimes.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom Ghislaine Maxwell's case is assigned.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to sexually abuse minor girls. Maxwell is accused of facilitating, aiding, and participating in Epstein's abuse of victims.
Maxwell is alleged to have befriended, groomed, and delivered minor victims to be sexually abused by Epstein and, in some cases, by herself.
Epstein is alleged to have sexually abused minor girls, with acts including sexualized massages and other sexual contact.

events.title: Arrest and Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and an indictment was unsealed charging her with conspiracy to sexually abuse minors and perjury.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Conspiracy
events.description: The timeframe during which Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell made several false statements under oath during a civil proceeding deposition, leading to perjury charges.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors as young as 14 years old between 1994 and 1997.
Maxwell's alleged role included recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of victims, sometimes by being present during the abuse.
The abuse allegedly occurred at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as at Maxwell's residence in London.
Maxwell was also charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath in a 2016 civil deposition.
The press release emphasizes that the charges are allegations and the defendant is presumed innocent until proven guilty.
